benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to bundle

covered: Valid Request: Successful updates with required and optional headers (TC01, TC02).
Path parameter validation – invalid UUID format (TC04).
Invalid Payload – malformed JSON and missing body (TC07, TC08).
Input validation – extra unsupported fields in body (TC09).
Edge cases – maximum number of custom fields (TC13), maximum value length (TC14), empty value (TC15).
URL robustness – extra unexpected query parameters are ignored (TC16).
Performance – normal load response time <2 s (TC17) and peak load concurrency (TC18).
Regression – handling of special characters (TC19) and backward‑compatible client behavior (TC25).
Integration error handling – inconsistent dependent service data leads to 500 (TC20).
Recovery – retry after transient network failure succeeds (TC21).
State variations – bundles with no existing custom fields (TC22) and with existing fields (TC23, TC24).
gaps: Partial Update: No test verifies that partial updates are rejected when the API expects a full replace.
Concurrency race condition: No scenario where two conflicting updates are performed simultaneously to test optimistic/pessimistic locking.
Rate Limiting: No tests to ensure the API throttles excessive requests appropriately.
Caching behavior: No verification of caching headers (e.g., ETag, Cache‑Control) for PUT responses, if applicable.
recommendations: Add a test case that attempts a partial update (e.g., sending only a subset of fields) and expects a 400/409 response if partial updates are not allowed.
Create a concurrency test where two requests modify the same bundle at the same time and verify proper handling of race conditions (e.g., version conflict error).
Introduce rate‑limiting tests that send a burst of requests and assert that the API returns 429 Too Many Requests after the defined threshold.
If the API returns caching headers on successful PUT, add assertions to validate ETag or Cache‑Control values.
